definition: to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
emigrant/to reside abroad
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju

sentences.english: My old friend Harrison, had lived in the Mediterranean for years before he returned to England.
sentences.chinese: 哈利逊是我的旧友，侨居地中海多年，近返英国。

sentences.english: They have taken away Chinese nation's bright civilization for the country of residence.
sentences.chinese: 他们为侨居国带去了中华民族的灿烂文明。

sentences.english: To cultivate enabling relationship with Chinese authorities here and diaspora.
sentences.chinese: 培养中国当局与侨居者的亲善关系。

sentences.english: So far, Su Guchun has over 500 descendants, more than 400 of whom have lived in Southeast Asia.
sentences.chinese: 至今有五六百人，其中400余人侨居东南亚等地。
我们的老师正侨居海外。

sentences.english: When they were few in number, strangers in the land.
sentences.chinese: 当他们在那地侨居时，寥寥无几而人数极稀。

sentences.english: Southeast Asia is where most overseas Chinese from Fujian Province reside.
sentences.chinese: 东南亚是闽籍华侨的主要侨居地。

definition: to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to make one's home in/to reside in/to inhabit
to move (from one residence to another)
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
overseas Chinese/(in a restricted sense) Chinese emigrant who still retains Chinese nationality/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
expatriates
ancestral hometown/original domicile (and civil registration)
the whole family
former residence/one's original home
to stay away from home/residence abroad/sojourn
accompanied by one's dependents/encumbered by wife and children
to migrate/to move house
Chinese person who returns to China after living as an expatriate
to register as domiciled in another land/naturalization
indigenous
